intro: Plectranthus viscosus, commonly known as sticky plectranthus, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky secretion, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers that are usually purple or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Plectranthus viscosus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
